channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Distil-Whisper: Robust Knowledge Distillation via Large-Scale Pseudo Labelling
item.description: As the size of pre-trained speech recognition models increases, running these large models in low-latency or resource-constrained environments becomes challenging.

item.title: OpenChat: Advancing Open-source Language Models with Mixed-Quality Data
item.description: Specifically, we consider the general SFT training data, consisting of a small amount of expert data mixed with a large proportion of sub-optimal data, without any preference labels.

item.title: Low-latency Real-time Voice Conversion on CPU
item.description: To our knowledge LLVC achieves both the lowest resource usage as well as the lowest latency of any open-source voice conversion model.

item.title: GLM-130B: An Open Bilingual Pre-trained Model
item.description: We introduce GLM-130B, a bilingual (English and Chinese) pre-trained language model with 130 billion parameters.

item.title: GPT-Fathom: Benchmarking Large Language Models to Decipher the Evolutionary Path towards GPT-4 and Beyond
item.description: With the rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs), there is a pressing need for a comprehensive evaluation suite to assess their capabilities and limitations.

item.title: An Image is Worth 16x16 Words: Transformers for Image Recognition at Scale
item.description: While the Transformer architecture has become the de-facto standard for natural language processing tasks, its applications to computer vision remain limited.

item.title: A Survey of Large Language Models for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Recently, large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated abilities including understanding context, logical reasoning, and generating answers.

item.title: OpenAgents: An Open Platform for Language Agents in the Wild
item.description: Language agents show potential in being capable of utilizing natural language for varied and intricate tasks in diverse environments, particularly when built upon large language models (LLMs).

item.title: ManimML: Communicating Machine Learning Architectures with Animation
item.description: A user can take a preexisting neural network architecture and easily write a specification for an animation in ManimML, which will then automatically compose animations for different components of the system into a final animation of the entire neural network.

item.title: VideoCrafter1: Open Diffusion Models for High-Quality Video Generation
item.description: The I2V model is designed to produce videos that strictly adhere to the content of the provided reference image, preserving its content, structure, and style.

item.title: LoRA: Low-Rank Adaptation of Large Language Models
item.description: We propose Low-Rank Adaptation, or LoRA, which freezes the pre-trained model weights and injects trainable rank decomposition matrices into each layer of the Transformer architecture, greatly reducing the number of trainable parameters for downstream tasks.

item.title: VideoReTalking: Audio-based Lip Synchronization for Talking Head Video Editing In the Wild
item.description: Our system disentangles this objective into three sequential tasks: (1) face video generation with a canonical expression; (2) audio-driven lip-sync; and (3) face enhancement for improving photo-realism.

item.title: DeepSpeed Inference: Enabling Efficient Inference of Transformer Models at Unprecedented Scale
item.description: DeepSpeed Inference reduces latency by up to 7. 3X over the state-of-the-art for latency-oriented scenarios and increases throughput by over 1. 5x for throughput-oriented scenarios.

item.title: Skywork: A More Open Bilingual Foundation Model
item.description: In this technical report, we present Skywork-13B, a family of large language models (LLMs) trained on a corpus of over 3. 2 trillion tokens drawn from both English and Chinese texts.

item.title: Recognize Any Regions
item.description: Understanding the semantics of individual regions or patches within unconstrained images, such as in open-world object detection, represents a critical yet challenging task in computer vision.

item.title: Learning From Mistakes Makes LLM Better Reasoner
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) recently exhibited remarkable reasoning capabilities on solving math problems.

item.title: Evaluating Large Language Models: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description: We hope that this comprehensive overview will stimulate further research interests in the evaluation of LLMs, with the ultimate goal of making evaluation serve as a cornerstone in guiding the responsible development of LLMs.

item.title: Diffusion Models for Reinforcement Learning: A Survey
item.description: Diffusion models have emerged as a prominent class of generative models, surpassing previous methods regarding sample quality and training stability.

item.title: VoxPoser: Composable 3D Value Maps for Robotic Manipulation with Language Models
item.description: The composed value maps are then used in a model-based planning framework to zero-shot synthesize closed-loop robot trajectories with robustness to dynamic perturbations.

item.title: Towards Foundation Models for Knowledge Graph Reasoning
item.description: The key challenge of designing foundation models on KGs is to learn such transferable representations that enable inference on any graph with arbitrary entity and relation vocabularies.
